message: Utron - A lightweight MVC framework for Go(Golang).
story: Mohamed Alaa El Din shared a link to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: gernest/utron
caption: github.com
description: utron - A lightweight MVC framework for Go(Golang)

data.message:
My problem with most Golang web frameworks is that they're always fighting the language. Constantly under this gridlock of trying to port a framework from another language while retaining most of its inherent features. Most of which are attributed to the implementation language. 
I suppose that's why I've personally mostly elected to go for net/http to carry out most of my work.
The boilerplate grows exponentially though, until you take the time to extract some common patterns from your work into a reusable package.

The community at large is mostly oriented towards this common patterns methodology than embracing a single source of truth regarding an idiomatic framework.

Surprisingly though, most gophers are ex-rubyist and python engineers. I've always been baffled at that thought.
I reckon it's how the core team have mostly influenced and positioned the language.

For instance, core ruby does afterall, embrace rails as the defacto standard to web development in ruby.

in my opinion, Go doesn't need a framework, 
because Go is Go, not { python, ruby, php, java .. etc }
